body:
I roughly got the idea that the appendMessageBuffer() 's position should be =0 .
is this the case.

> With due respect, I do not see how this pull request helps enhance readability or its optimization goals. Could you @mxsm provide additional reasoning to clarify?

Hello @lizhanhui  I think this pr code more semantic, object1 and object2  attributes  that It doesn't look very formal. Give the feel of a test case. This is my idea.

> Hi @complone You can import rocketmq code style xml for develop tools.

Thank you for your reply. I'm a little unhappy recently. I'll update this PR in two days

@lizhanhui @caigy @vintagewang @duhengforever 
For the first PR submission, could you please help to open the CI. Thank you very much.
@aaron-ai any idea?
Hi, in my opinion, original code is more readable, such code encapsulation is redundant.

IMO, the set operation mainly sets the ```refCount``` to negative so that cleanupOver can be forced after a timeout. So if you use +, the ```refCount``` might still be positive. (The way I understand it, it's probably better to just make ```refCount``` negative)
@tsunghanjacktsai @lizhanhui  I agree with you, I will close this PR
@shenmiren0002  Whether you can provide more information? RocketMQ version, source code and so on
Nice catch!

I aggre with you, but the code is really confusing and may be misunderstood as "-1000" has special meaning.

> IMO, the set operation mainly sets the `refCount` to negative so that cleanupOver can be forced after a timeout. So if you use +, the `refCount` might still be positive. (The way I understand it, it's probably better to just make `refCount` negative)

> @lizhanhui @caigy @vintagewang @duhengforever For the first PR submission, could you please help to open the CI. Thank you very much.

done.
Nice catch! Are you willing to submit a PR to fix it?

@shenmiren0002 you create DefaultMQPushConsumer as bean that can't automatic injection. you can see the rocketmq-spring-boot-starter source code, if you want to setting you can use RocketMQMessageListener annotation to do this.
Yes of course.I will try to fix it with the 2th solution.

Hi @lizhimins, this does not affect loading, but such error logs do mislead users. I have submitted a PR to fix this issue, PTAL~

在复杂的生产环境下，比如说对应的时间点有 ha 切换，时间可能会回退的更小，所以依赖这个时间也不是很准确。我们总是希望通过幂等的处理逻辑来更好的支持重新消费，比如说希望重置到 2:00，这时候一般会选择 1:55 作为起始时间戳。
当然这里提出的二分后向左扫描一下也很有意义的，欢迎提交 pr 来改进这个细节～
Looks like we cannot verify the fix in CI as it keeps failing...

I think you have the same issue I had  before. 

If you have several projects use same consumer group, check all your consumer project code whether there is a consumer don't call subscribe method.

All consumer in same consumer group must call subscribe method to bind the same consumer group subscription. If a consumer only call start method, then it will clean consumer group subscription. 

This is because of https://rocketmq.apache.org/zh/docs/4.x/bestPractice/21subscribe 

And I think this clean design is very strange which cost several hours to fix the deep bug.
